titleNullable: Shop Sales within Baldur's Gate city.
subtitleNullable: A database simulating the sales of a NPC in Baldur's Gate
descriptionNullable: # Subject: Request for Data Analysis Collaboration **** Dear Data Analyst Extraordinaire, I'm Fizzlewhiz Gearspark, proud owner of **"Gearspark's Emporium for Adventurers"** in *Baldur's Gate*. Our emporium, catering to the whims of adventurers, holds a wealth of sales data over the years that awaits your discerning eye. I seek your expertise to unravel insights that could elevate our product offerings and enhance the overall satisfaction of our esteemed customers. Your talent for deciphering data patterns aligns perfectly with the intricate gears of our emporium. **I believe your analytical prowess can unlock hidden potentials within our sales records.** I'd be delighted to share our dataset and discuss how your insights could shape the future of Gearspark's Emporium. Best, Proprietor, Gearspark's Emporium Baldur's Gate **** ## Hi there I created this database to **practice Data Analysis**. I chose this theme because of my interest in the game Baldur's Gate 3, and also because it is currently in the spotlight. I thought about using the DnD universe calendar, but the eras are counted differently, and it would create unnecessary complexity. Instead, I decided to use the start date of [BG3 production](https://larian.com/support/faqs/general-information_46) until today's date. I decided not to use items of ***very rare*** and ***legendary*** rarity because I wanted to simulate the sales of a common vendor Pls upvote and leave a comment **** ## Data Dictionary: **Relationships between tables**: *** **Currency**: Coin |CP| SP|EP|GP| PP ------------- |--- |--- |-- |-- |-- Copper (cp) | 1| 10 |50 |100| 1,000 Silver (sp) |1/10| 1| 5| 10| 100 Electrum (ep)| 1/50| 1/5| 1| 2| 20 Gold (gp) |1/100| 1/10| 1/2| 1 |10 Platinum (pp)|1/1,000| 1/100| 1/20| 1/10| 1 *** ***sales*** table: attributes | meaning ---------- |------------- sale_id | sale ID date | sale date customer_id | customer ID product_id | product ID price | product price product_name | produt name *** ***customers*** table: attributes | meaning ---------- |------------- customer_id| customer ID name| customer name sex| customer gender race| customer race age| customer age class| customer class * Note 1: The age range varies according to the race, with some being able to live for centuries. ***all_products*** table: attributes | meaning -----------|------------- product_id| product ID product_name| product name price| product price type| product type * Note 2: ***type*** references the table that contains the product details, so '*type* = weapon' means that the product belongs to the 'details_weapons' table The other ***details_*** tables: attributes | meaning -----------|------------- item_id | Item ID; corresponds to the *product_id* attribute in the other tables name| product name price| product price damage| weapon damage ac| *armor class*, represents defences againts monster attacks weight| item weight requirements| item requeriments stealth| if the item affects the customer's *stealth* dc| *Difficulty Class*, means the number that needs to be achieved to succeed in a dice roll properties| item properties rarity| item rarity category| item category type| item type * Note 3: I decided to exclude from the database items with rarities ***Very Rare*** and ***Legendary*** **encounters** table: attributes | meaning ---------|------------- enc_id| encounter ID date| encounter date monster| monster type encounter_type| encounter type *** **Races Life Stage**: [source](https://www.reddit.com/r/DnD/comments/97a8to/oc_ive_finally_made_an_expanded_version_of_the/) *** ## Source: * The project [Repository](https://github.com/PatrickLeal/projeto_baldursgate_vendor_sales/tree/main) * Thumbnail [Image](https://br.pinterest.com/pin/303430093656908553/)
